title: Ticket #2040: Inconsistent file permissions when creating job-related files
description:
When creating job output files, Condor is inconsistent in which permissions it uses. In many places, it uses 0644, 0664, or 0666 (condor_submit, condor_starter). In a few places, it uses 0600 (gahp_server, nordugrid_gahp). We should use the same permissions everywhere, with certain exceptions (credential files).

The OSG Glidein Factory is running in problems with this. Condor_submit will pre-create output files with 0644 permissions. If the files are deleted before the job completes (by a file cleanup utility), the gahp_server will recreate the files with 0600 permissions. They have tools that run as a different user that need to be able to read these files.
